message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.LG 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on mobile edge computing and offloading computationally intensive jobs to the Access Point (AP), which falls under the domain of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper deals with offloading jobs to a shared resource (AP) and proposes a pricing mechanism to incentivize users to internalize the negative externality of delay they cause to other users. This falls under the domain of distributed computing. 
3. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes a learning-based pricing mechanism where no knowledge of individual user profit functions is required. This involves the use of information theory concepts to design the mechanism. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a priority pricing scheme to serve heterogeneous users and maximize social welfare. This involves designing a control system to optimize the pricing mechanism. 
5. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper proposes a learning-based pricing mechanism to overcome the signalling overhead and false reporting of private profit information by users. This involves the use of machine learning techniques to learn the optimal prices and average edge delays at equilibrium.
